datafield.subfield: Ḥāshiyat al-Sayyid al-Sharīf al-ʻalāmah ʻalá Sharḥ al-Shamsīyah fī ʻilm al-maʻqūlāt,
Shelfmark: Ann Arbor, University of Michigan, Special Collections Library, Isl. Ms. 608
Origin: As appears in colophon on fol.101b copied by Muḥammad ibn Maḥmūd [...?]. Copying finished in the middle of Shaʻbān 942 [February 1536].
Accompanying materials: a. Inventory cataloguing slips in hand of Winifred Smeaton Thomas. -- b. Acquisitions slip from Yahuda.
Former shelfmark: From inner front cover and spine label, "IL 84" (likely supplied by Yahuda).

Binding: Pasteboard covered in marbled paper (in lavender, blue and white) with light brown leather on the spine and fore-edge flap (nearly half-bound); Type II binding (with flap); intact and likely later than text.

Support: non-European laid paper; non-"Mamluk" with slightly curved (wavy), single chain lines running horizontally and separated by roughly 32 cm. ; laid lines running vertically and spaced roughly 8-9 laid lines per cm. (see fol.5 for very clear chain lines); flyleaves of European laid paper with watermark partially visible "AGNANI" [?].

Decoration: Text rubricated with words such as "qāla" marking the dialogic relationship between this gloss and text which it is glossing, in red; red overlines and flourishes are also occasionally used.

Script: Naskh; very small hand with alifs just under 2 mm. high, having an Eastern and possibly Persian character; lām alifs have a prominent barbed serif on the left-hand ascender; an upward-spiraling hāʼ is used in the colophon (fol. 101b); elongated swooping tails on some final letters; tanwīn al-fatḥah is marked, hamzah and shaddah are not.
Layout: Written in 17 lines per page; frame-ruled.

Collation: 9 V (90), VI-1 (101) (final quire could be V+1 but numerous repairs make it difficult to ascertain; sewing appears after the 6th folio); catchwords present; pagination in pencil, Western numerals (referenced in cataloguing).
Colophon: "Scribal," triangular, reads: "تم الكتاب بعون الملك الوهاب [...؟] عباد الله محمد بن محمود [...؟] في اواسط شهر شعبان المعظم في سنة اثنين واربعين وتسعمائة"

Explicit: "ان التصديق بوجود الموضوع جزء من العلم وهذا الجواب مردود لان الشيخ الرئيس قد صرح في الشفاء بان التصديق بوجود الموضوع من المبادى التصديقية فلا يكون جزء على [...؟] بل مندرجا في المبادى التصديقية"
Incipit: " قال ورتبته على مقدمة و[ثلاث] مقالات وخاتمة اقول هكذا وجدنا عبارة المتن في كثير من النسخ والصواب "

Gloss on the commentary by Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Rāzī Quṭb al-Dīn al-Taḥtānī, (d.766/1365) on al-Risālah al-shamsīyah, a treatise on logic by ʻAlī ibn ʻUmar al-Qazwīnī (d. 675/1276). Description provided by Noah Gardiner.
Acquired in 1926 from the bookseller Isaac Benjamin S.E. Yahuda via purchase transacted on his behalf by Abraham Shalom Yahuda (1877-1951), his younger brother.

Occasional marginal corrections throughout, many in the copyist's hand, all marked with abbreviation or ligature for ṣaḥḥa; marks of collation in the form of "بلغ" appear frequently throughout; only note of any significant length appears on fol.89a (in nastaʻlīq).
حاشية السيد الشريف العلامة على شرح الشمسية في علم المعقولات,
